{{refimprove|date=October 2020}} {{Other uses|Tempo (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox comics character| image = Tempo A.JPG |caption = Tempo as an Acolyte |character_name = Tempo |real_name = Heather Tucker |species = [[Mutant (Marvel Comics)|Human Mutant]] |publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] |debut = ''[[New Mutants]]'' #86 (February 1990) |creators = [[Louise Simonson]]
[[Rob Liefeld]] |alliances = [[Mutant Liberation Front]]
[[Marauders (comic book)|Marauders]]
[[Acolytes (comics)|Acolytes]] |aliases = Harriet Solomon |powers = Flight
Time manipulation |}} '''Tempo''' is a [[fictional]] [[African-American]] [[Mutant (Marvel Comics)|mutant]] character appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. She was introduced as a member of the [[Mutant Liberation Front]] in ''[[New Mutants]]'' #86 (February 1990). ==Publication history== Tempo first appeared in ''[[New Mutants]]'' #86. ==Fictional character biography== Tempo (alter ego Heather Tucker) is a founding member of the [[terrorist]] organization known as the Mutant Liberation Front (MLF). Tempo is a mainstay in the team's adventures, including fighting [[Wolverine (character)|Wolverine]], [[Sunfire (comics)|Sunfire]], [[X-Factor (comics)|X-Factor]] and others in the name of mutant rights, using her time-bending powers.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} The MLF destroy the Tucker Clinic, an institute for pregnant mothers to undergo [[prenatal]] [[DNA]] testing to determine whether or not their babies would be mutants, resulting in the death of Dr. Tucker. The story hints that Tempo may have been his daughter.''X-Factor'' #78 (May 1992) Soon after, a tyrannical despot named [[Reignfire]] reforms the MLF and tasks them with killing [[Henry Peter Gyrich]]. Tempo intervenes to save Gyrich and is exiled from the MLF.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} After leaving the MLF, [[Cable (comics)|Cable]] invites Tempo to join X-Force but she declines, choosing instead to go to college and put aside the super-powered lifestyle.{{issue|date=January 2013}} She is again briefly affiliated with the MLF during ''[[Operation: Zero Tolerance]]''.{{issue|date=January 2013}} ''X-Force'' #67 (June 1997) After [[Decimation (comics)|M-Day]], Tempo is one of the few to retain her powers. She then becomes a member of the reformed [[Acolytes (comics)|Acolytes]].{{Issue|date=February 2011}} When they disband, she joins Utopia and works alongside the X-Men.{{Issue|date=February 2011}} In [[Age of X]], Tempo is transformed into a soldier of Fortress X.{{cite web|author= George A. Tramountanas |url=http://www.cbr.com/x-position-mike-carey-on-the-age-of-x-aftermath/ |title=X-POSITION: Mike Carey on the "Age of X" Aftermath |publisher=CBR |date=2011-06-21 |accessdate=2016-12-12}} Tempo is fatally wounded while battling humans, but before she dies [[Rogue (comics)|Legacy]] absorbs her memories.''X-Men Legacy'' #245 Before being recruited into the [[Marauders (comic book)|Marauders]], Tempo was in a relationship with another mutant, Bouncer (Renata Da Lima), but they broke up.''Marauders'' Annual #1 ==Powers and abilities== Tempo can manipulate time. She is able to slow or stop her opponents and speed up either herself or her teammates. She has prevented grenades from exploding by keeping them in suspended motion, and was also able to successfully attack [[Rogue (comics)|Rogue]] by amplifying Rogue's speed, causing her to crash into a wall while flying. Strain limits how long Tempo can maintain a major time manipulation. While it was never established how long that limit is, she was able to completely freeze the X-Men for several minutes while she and the Acolytes conducted a thorough search of the X-Men mansion.''X-Men'' (vol. 2) #202 (October 2007) Tempo can also levitate herself and fly at subsonic speeds.{{Issue|date=January 2013}} Besides offering her physical protection, Tempo's helmet also contains electronic equipment that provides her with resistance to [[Cable (comics)|Cable]]'s telepathic probes.''X-Factor'' #78 (May 1992) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://uncannyxmen.net/characters/tempo UncannyXmen.net Character Profile on Tempo] [[Category:Characters created by Louise Simonson]] [[Category:Characters created by Rob Liefeld]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1990]] [[Category:Fictional African-American people]] [[Category:Fictional characters who can manipulate time]] [[Category:Fictional lesbians]] [[Category:Marvel Comics female supervillains]] [[Category:Marvel Comics LGBT superheroes]] [[Category:Marvel Comics mutants]]
